comment.author: 23800206@N02
comment._content:
See how they just walked the streets freely.
Where are the security and bodyguards?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: During the Inaugural Parade and the events surrounding it, Indiana Governor Thomas R. Marshall, the Vice President Elect, was escorted by sixty cadets of the Black Horse Troop of Indiana's Culver Military Academy. This photo shows cadets escorting Marshall from the church he attended on Sunday, March 2, 1913. The Inauguration was held two days later.
